Link Mash (January 28, 2014)

Jan 28, 2014
2 minute read

The weekly Link Mash is a curated selection of tools, stories, and other links that I found during my travels on the web. All of my links can be found on my Pinboard; you can also find the Link Mash archives here.

Introducing my regular Link Mash: a collection of curated stories, tools, ideas, and ramblings that I hope you find interesting.

  • Sifttter: An IFTTT to Day One Logger. I’ve struggled mightily with journaling over my life; it often starts as a meaningful exercise and quickly morphs into just another todo. Sifttter is a great utility that, I hope, will change that: it uses IFTTT to send various “activities” – Foursquare checkins, Facebook/Twitter/Instagram posts, Toodledo tasks, etc. – that I accomplish throughout my day to my Day One journal.
  • Tempo – A Smarter Calendar. I’ve tried over a dozen calendar apps for iOS. Some of them have nice user interfaces, some of them have decent functionality, but I’ve struggled to find one that really fits my workflow. Tempo changes that. Some of my favorite features: automatic dial-in for conference calls, associated documents/emails/etc. with calendar invites, and the ability to email/SMS select members of the group.
  • Google Sure Asks Great Video Game Questions. I often downplay the value of using Google as a social research tool: start typing and let your fellow world citizens show you what’s important to them. Combine that with my love of video games and you get an easy way to waste an hour.
  • The Classic Bic Pen Now Works On Your Smartphone Display Too. I’ve struggled to figure out whether I like an iPad + stylus note-taking system. Sometimes, chicken scratch with a pen is best. Can Bic solve both problems for me?
  • Google Glass finally works with prescription glasses, frames cost $225. Like most geeks, I have a I’m-really-skeptical-but-still-intrigued attitude toward Google Glass. The fact that it now works with prescription lenses is great. The bad part? “That’s $225 on top of the $1,499 Google charges for Glass, bringing the total cost to $1,724.”
  • How the Colors Got Their Names. I would never have asked, “How did colors get their names?” I wish I had. Fascinating read.
  • Evernote, the bug-ridden elephant. Jason Kincaid wrote a really interesting piece about the troubles he sees with Evernote these days; I happen to agree with many of them. The most interesting part? Phil Libin, Evernote’s CEO, responded to it.
  • Scientific Evidence That Walking While Texting Is Bad. Cool; I suppose I’ll be that lame guy who texts while sitting on his couch.
  • How Often Do You Really Need to Shower? I tend to take a lot of showers; it’s comforting, I think really well in there, and I find it to make me a happier person.
Theme crafted with <3 by John Otander (@4lpine).
